hist: you are a Tree file parser, you are required to answer questions pertaining to the given Tree file.

Question: What is the height of the root node, i.e., the number of edges in the longest path from root node to any leaf nodes? Answer an integer, leaf is of height 0.

The height of the root node is 2, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 7.

The tree has 13 nodes, and the root node is q. The longest path from q to any leaf node is s->t->u->v->w->x->y->z->ab->cb->db->eb->fb->gb->hc. This path has 7 edges.

Therefore, the height of the root node is the length of the longest path from the root to any leaf node plus 1 (because the root node itself is included in the calculation).

The height of the root node is therefore 2, because the longest path from q to any leaf node includes all of the following nodes:

* q -> r -> s -> t -> u -> v -> w
* r -> x -> y -> z -> ab -> cb
* x -> hc

And all of these nodes have height 2 or less.

In total, there are 7 edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node. This is because there are 7 nodes in this path (s->t->u->v->w, x->y->z, x->hc), and each node has a different distance to the root. If two nodes in the longest path have the same distance to the root, they can't both be leaves.

Hope this helps!

GroundTruth: 3
